fields.physical_description:
Resist printed, block printed, painted, plain weave cotton, hand-woven, quilted, backed with roller printed, plain weave cotton and faced with bias-cut woven woollen twill.
In the middle of a cream ground is a small rosette surrounded by an 8-lobed central medallion in light blue with a light yellow and cream ground each lobe framing a red and light blue flowering stem.  A quarter of this design appears in each corner.  In the middle of the upper and lower edge of this central panel are two light blue leafy stems with exotic blossoms and stylised fruit and buds in red, light blue, grey and black; some of the larger flowers form a circular frame around the central medallion.  The central panel is framed by a composite border: a narrow edge of a thin meander on yellow either side of a white border containing a black stem meander holding red and blue flowers with blue details. A wider band with a white ground contains a larger scale leafy meander in black and blue bearing exotic blossoms and buds in similar colours and in four variations.
In each of the outer corners is an inward pointing floral stem in light blue with red details; there are two variations, in diagonally opposing corners.
The narrow edge and wide border are repeated and the outer most border is undecorated red.  Down the  left hand side part of one of the narrow borders has only partly been printed: only red and light blue has been used - the dark lines are missing.  There are so many minor differences in the design that it suggests much of the pattern has been drawn and painted rather than printed.
Backing: pieced; cream ground with small red botehs edged with black and filled with red floral motifs; offset rows, each row facing in the opposite direction.  A red leafy line links the motifs.  One piece of the backing has only been printed in one colour; it ought to have been over-printed with a second red to produce the dark lines and complete the design.
There is a layer of padding and diagonal lines of stitches have been used to quilt through these three layers.
Facing: bias cut dark blue woollen twill with offset rows of botehs; each facing in the opposite direction. Light yellow and light blue.
fields.materials_techniques: cotton yarn, woollen yarn, weaving, resist printing, block printing, roller printing, quilting, sewing, painting.
fields.history_note: Purchased for the Museum by Robert Murdoch Smith, from Sidney Churchill in Tehran, this was acquired as a batch of fourteen carpets and carpet fragments and ten specimens of qalamkari printed cotton. Murdoch Smith wrote: "Among the articles are a number of carpets and pieces of carpets of the 17th century and earlier date (some as early as the end of the 15th century or beginning of the 16th century) which will, I think, form a valuable addition to the Museum collection. Some of the best specimens - small pieces, not whole carpets - were got from the rufuqir or darners of worn and torn carpets in the Teheran bazaar."
